reviews.review_msg: Old-school. Passes around attendance sign-ins during lecture and calls out people leaving the lecture hall. Homework and tests are essentially the same so nobody should be surprised by the tests if they did the homework. Lectures are easy to follow but the subject matter and content delivery is unavoidably extremely dry.

She explains in detail and respects every one. You may need to read textbook for your further understanding but its not mandatory. Participation is not mandatory but for you own good attend the classes and just listen. In SFU she uploaded her lecture notes with the video of each class. Finally, she scale up marks so much at the end.
The material isn't bad if you read the book and do the assignments. Learned nothing from lecture. Class average was really low but she scaled really nicely
Lectures are pretty important sicne she is pretty good at explaining. Exams are rather hard though.

She taught ENSC220 with much enthusiasm and really wanted us to learn. However, the way the exams were graded is quiet unfair: 1 wrong answer could mean -30%. She also has the habit of unintentionally sounding mean. When you know her personally though, she's pretty cool. My last impression: it was a good class, I learned a lot.
No Comments
No Comments
hard to understand through the accent
set the curve very well...
No Comments
No Comments
botted bruh
No reviews for almost 10 years and then 11 excellent reviews in one day. Hmm....
Incredible! This guy is very good super sigma
His lectures tend to be a bit boring and disorganized but he is very nice
Basically, he is the worst teacher I have ever seen. His teaching is as lousy as his appearance. Try not to be ripped off by him, take Ash instead of him!!

Makes everything look comlicated, he has errors in his note but doesnt want to admit it. He is always out to get people who are copying. We learned more in 2 days that Ash was subing for him. Try to take this class with Ash.
No Comments
He basily doesn't know what he is doing at all.  There is point for going to his lecture.
unorganized

-Ali was an inspirational professor who taught the circuits course in a very engaging and clear manner. He encouraged questions in the class and frequently asked students to provide feedback on his performance. He made sure, the students are on the same page as him and was able to convey technical and theoretical knowledge in an eloquent manner.

Lectures are short and most of it was examples. Homework is long, but exam is easier than the homework. The syllabus said there will be 34 labs only, but there was 5 labs. All on LTspice, so if you use Mac, make sure you know how to use it. Exams are fair and easy if you understand the lecture.

Very nice prof, probably the best I have taken in Engineering at SFU so far(taken 280 and 220 with Atousa). Ready to help and explain if you come to her office hours and show your interest. I would love to take a course with Atousa again.
Good teacher, had her for 280 Not lower than 3.5 -4

Has to be the least organized prof at sfu. Confuses a lot regarding course material and due dates of assignments. Would forget to give homework for a whole month and make a lot of assignments due at the couple of end weeks. Would not recommend taking ANY class with her. But again with 220 & 280 i dont think u have another choice. May god be with u.

She knows what she's doing but makes a lot of mistakes in class, wasting time. Doesn't know the material nearly as well as other professors, and if you take 220 with her you're going to suffer when you take 320 and 225 with Bird and Ash. She just doesn't cover the material in the same depth as other professors do. At least she's easy.

Many people say about how easy Atousa is. Well, she is, but this is one of the most fundamental courses in ENSC and the easier the prof is, the more you'll have to study on your own. I just wish I never took this class with her...
Excellent professor. This course is easy so u just need to attend lectures. That's all.

She knows what she is talking about, but she has a bored tone when she speaks and isn't especially good at communicating material. Also, assignments are too challenging. However, the final exam was pretty easy. If you don't attend lectures just go through examples in the textbook and you'll be fine.

Don't take a course with her if you want to learn. It might be easy to get a B or higher, but that does not mean you learned anything. She is not helpful at all if you have questions as she will explain things again in the exactly same way that you did not understand the first time. Conclusion: avoid her.
best prof ever!!!
She's awesome, Go Atousa
She made me hate engineering altogether! she is a very bad teacher, has no idea what she is talking about and has a horrible accent! never take any course with her
I think she is now a changed person. She made ENSC220 much easier now. Maybe too easy. =/

She is by far the worst prof I have ever had!! she is very unclear in the lectures and teaches very easy material but asks you to solve complicated material in the exams. she also doesnt scale so half the class fails!! horrible final as well

This course was mandatory for me. Although she is interested in the material, she is terrible at passing on the interest or information to students. She copies previous semester notes in class and fails to actively do problem sets. The TA's are unreliable. Textbook is terrible, provides poor sample problems and does not show  worked solutions.

This course is tough especially 1/3 into the class. Atousa has really Clear notes, however i would like her to do more advance examples. Her MT/Final are not that difficult but the material itself is really difficult to understand.

Why does she need to grade so harshly? Does she get commissioned by the number of students she fail? Usually I keep my opinion about teachers to myself, but Atousa is the reason I visited this website.
not very difficult-she is kind of OK,but remember to read the book and do more problems than she give you if you want to get a good mark.

Very good teacher. Cares a lot about for students and spends time to help us understand. The course was not easy but she tried to make it fun and showed us practical examples and applications. Fair exam.

I tell you with absolutely honesty, do NOT take any classes with her. You rather wait one or two semesters more for the same course taught by another professor. Her lectures consists going through textbook examples, and her exam problems are selected from the hardest, most brutal questions from the textbook. I studied real hard, but I still failed.
If you want to earn some gardes in ENSC classes, her course will help you as long as you keep up with others. If you really want to learn something, i will say, she is not good at that.
She has no idea how to make the class keep up and gives no practice whatsoever.
She bores the hell out of me!
I think she has the potential to be a helpful and she tries so hard to be helpful, go to her office hours you will get your answers
Pathetic, seems like a capable teacher but doesn't know how to make tests, unfair grading scheme and bad bad tests
He is the choice if you want to learn. He knows his stuff. Student could learn a lot from his lectures but be ready to study really hard.
his all over the place, teaches many topics but doesn't cover them at all in any exam . he is only comfortable on what he knows around his notes . Shouldn't be teaching in SFU
Cant teach, Simply copies stuff from his notes on over head w/o explanation, useless tutorials, midterm avg was less than %40. Overall he shouldnt be teaching any material at SFU
Great prof.
Satisfactory prof
rabus with run a bus through your brain. do not take this guy I beg
turns into mr mumbo jumbo during lectures as he seemingly forgets how to do half the questions on the notes. by far the worst professor I've had in my time at SFU. he seems like a great guy, though.
he has a heavy accent when teaching. His 3rd midterm test was so hard for no reason, and he kept changing the questions on the test as it wasn't even finished.
In his own world. Considering he took on this class last min means hes regurgitating ash's material. He went easy on lab and exam marks cuz of the quality of lectures ig lol.

Ash runs an engaging class, though tests can be challenging. Using unstuck AI and practicing past questions helped me stay on top of the material. Overall, a worthwhile course if you're willing to put in the work.

Fun and caring professor. He tries his best to ensure students understand the fundamental concepts and the practical topics which will be useful for future courses. Exams are difficult but fair, and lab tests are very straightforward.

Lectures are helpful and entertaining, you feel he is one of your friends. Expectations are pretty clear, lab tests are hard to fail as long as you practice before hand. Exams are challenging but not if you practice a lot and can do all of the practice and lecture questions. Ash does his best to make the class fun and for you not to fail
Ash is a nice guy but pretty useless lectures and will scale the grades to his liking at the end of the term.
Scaled the grades so much, but no one understand anything with a 45% final average...

Ash could be an amazing professor if he didn't have the tendency to get defensive when students are asking him questions. Students ask questions because they want to understand the material, not because they are doubting his knowledge of the material.
Lectures are fun and engaging, tests are tough but fair.
Ash uses the most awful marking scheme and then scales the class by an enormous amount. Not sure why he does this and is really unnecessary.
Ash made me realize that I am not fit to be an electronics engineer. Truly the GOAT of the Engineering Science department.
Doesn't explain the lecture content clearly

Pros
-prepared and can answer any question you have about the material
-passionate
-funny
-good explainer

Cons
-No excuses in his class, don't miss any labs/quizzes/pretty much anything because he won't care for what causes the absence (ie covid, losses, etc)
-Loses patience very easily
-Has a knack for making you feel bad about yourself
Ash is the G O A T. Awesome guy who is always willing to help you out and great lecturer. He's easily approachable and super funny!

Ash is a funny guy, and good in the lab. However, his tests are really poorly made. He has a strange curving system. Expect to get low on the test then he will scale the class at the end. Do not trust the grading scheme. It will constantly change throughout the course, and the dates of the exams will constantly change. Always expect an exam.
best ensc prof
Great prof. Highly recommend him. His exams are extremely hard but completely fair.

Ash is the best professor I have ever had in my 7 years at SFU. He works you hard, but in the end it's completely worth it because you'll be prepared for any kind of circuit problem. ALWAYS take a class with Ash!
Best prof ever!! Even if you do really bad on the midterm/final he scales by a lot, I went from a C- to a B. He also is so passonate about his students definetely take a course with him!!
I learnt a lot from him. His not only a prof but a mentor to me. If there is a future course taught by him , i will definitely enroll into his class.
best pro. Dun need book in class, but you will read it by yourself. He makes the subject interesting
Great Professor!
best prof in ensc.work hard

Ash !! the best in ensc :) marking for the final exam. He assigns lotz of work but that's all for our benefit :) He scaled the class nicely .His attitude towards each and every student is incredible and he really wants us to learn. He knows each and every one by name :) Ash u rock :)I wish he taught more ensc courses :(   ASh is the best

The best prof I've ever had. In a semester where ever Ralf Wittenberg struggled to finish the curriculum in time, Ash was done all our material and more, 2 WEEKS AHEAD OF TIME. Very reasonable marking, SUPER clear explanations, tells funny stories, super approachable and nice. Think taking a class with him is a bad idea? False.
good!
Cutest Prof ever! :D

Excellent professor. I have a great respect for this man's knowledge. He is Cristal clear and he never fails helping students. He is one of the best profs I've ever had. If you have any problems, go to his office and you come back with complete understanding.

Excellent prof. Enthusiastic and intelligent. Learned everyone's names, even. Clear and thorough teaching. Little tolerance for unmotivated students. Assignments and exams could be tricky, but scaled well. Lab tests were short, fast-paced, and unforgiving. Errors could easily carry through and destroy your mark. Text book was good and easy-to-read.
How could you doubt greatness!!!!
Best professor ever. He cares a lot for his students and truely makes sure that you learn things properly and to the heart.

He is the coolest professor in Ensc. His teaching might just be decent, but he deserves A+ on the attitude towards students. His exams are kind of tricky, but as long as you work hard, he won't give you a hard time.
Sheesh, i took 12ms instead of 10ms and i didn't do as well as i shoulda. TY for telling ROM (sp?) to shutup sometimes.
Great teacher. Some tricky problems on exams but if you practice the problems he recommends and always pay attention in class you will do well.

One of the nicest, friendliest, and happiest individual you'll ever meet. Helpful, fun lecture, but exams are very hard with only 25-30% max.partial mark. Learn andPRACTICE as much as you can! Okay if you keep above the average, even with a failed exam.
He has a major Hindu accent.Nice teacher. Exams are hard. Final grades are low. Course in general easy. BUT teacher gives bad marks, you wont fail, but u wont get an A either
He is a very helpful and a hard-working man. His accent makes his lecture a little unclear. The rest is cool.

His lectures and lecture notes lack structure. Often jumps from one topic to another. Formulas and graphs written on overhead are often not labelled and confusing. Exams are hard and unlike anything done in class or in textbooks and resemble IQ questions.
This guy can't speak. He and his funny Hindu accent makes the materials a lot more confusing. I mean....he pronounces circle as "sucker" and circuit as "suckit".
A good, laid back prof who expects a lot out of his students. Be sure to keep up or get left in his dust.
Very approachable. Fair marker but challenges his students. Funny guy with lotsa interesting engineering stories to tell.
Fun and easy, as long as you dont want anything from him ;)
Makes fun of the students
Funny, but goes way too fast
Funniest prof i've had. Goes a little too fast. Gotta love the stories he tells.

Lucky is a very helpful prof.he really knows the stuff well but seems to be a little bit disorganize. If you attend every class and ASK for help then you will get good mark. He really cares about his students and that's what I like about him. Hwk/assignment may be diffcult but marking is fair and he will guide you thru to solve the problems.
